revised_title: The Effect of Certain Drugs on the Non-Pregnant Human Uterus and Fallopian Tube
tldr: The author investigates the effects of adrenine and pituitrin on the isolated non-pregnant human uterus and Fallopian tube. The results suggest that adrenine has a motor effect on both organs, indicating a motor quality in the sympathetic nerve supply of the non-pregnant human uterus. Pituitrin stimulates the contraction of the uterus but has no significant effect on the Fallopian tube.
